column5: This is hardcore ice fishing done the Northern way!!! Myself, I like a nice hut with a good heater. It does look like there is a nice tent to warm up in though.
Cool, never seen a tomcod before today...Man that looks dang cold out there
Now I know why sasquatches are so rare these days.  The damn northerners are clubbing them all to make gloves.
There are two things us northerners enjoy in life. A hot cup of coffee and clubbed animals!
A seal walks into a bar and sits down. The bar tender asks the seal "what can I get you?" The seal answers "anything but a Canadian Club!!!!"
I should know better than to read the forum with anything liquid in my mouth
That's how northerners do it? I thought they cut a 50 foot slot in the ice so that they could cast.  Oh hell, where can I hide?
Hahaha.   That certainly looks cold, Dave.  I was chilly today it was only -10. I wish I had sasquatch genes.
I want a set of those gloves!!! They look pretty warm. A set of seal skin boots to go along with them would be nice too.
They look big.  You know what they say about big gloves and big boots.....

I actually own a pair of those gloves. You can purchase them ($350.00) in Alderville, Ontario on the reserve.  They are AMAZINGLY WARM...  My wife purchased them for me last christmas....if I could find a jacket/pants/boots I wouldn't hesitake
Can you even feel a fish bite, through 8 inches of fur?
Why does his hat have monkey ears sewn on?
